Walls of separation have been built up between the whites and the blacks. These walls of prejudice will tumble down of themselves as did the walls of Jericho, when Christians obey the Word of God, which enjoins on them supreme love to 
                                                                           487
their Maker and impartial love to their neighbors.--Review and Herald, Dec. 17, 1895; Republished in The Southern Work, 1966 ed., p. 43.
